review: Yummy and ideal for vegans!

name: foteini b.

name: Joyce R.
review: I make this all the time but vary the ingredients. I use finely chopped cabbage, minced carrots, green onions, a bit of grated ginger, minced garlic in moderation. Dash of soy sauce. I sometimes put a Thai pepper in the ingredients but only if the people I am serving enjoys hot. Put in food processor, pulse until ingredients are mixed thoroughly. Serve with orange/sriracha sauce.

name: Joyce R.
review: I make this all the time but vary the ingredients. I use finely chopped cabbage, minced carrots, green onions, a bit of grated ginger, minced garlic in moderation. Dash of soy sauce. review: This recipe was so awesome. I'm usually not a fan of powdered ginger, however the fresh ginger gave it a great taste. All the ingredients work very well together; fried in coconut oil too, gave it a very nice crisp taste.

name: Gail Stringfield
review: Delicious, really enjoyed, made to recipes but added a herb paprika rub, plus 1tblspn of kebab mania to the chicken mix.. I used sliced beans, green capsicum, carrot and home grown grated radish for the greens. Superb....

name: Amy Allen
review: My rolling skills need work, but otherwise it was good!

name: reed
review: these did not turn out at all the rice papers stuck and it was a big glob on the serving plate. we used a spoon to dish it up. the flavor was great. we wasted over half of the dinner because that much stuck. I will not use rice papers again in a dish like this.

name: Davis
review: Turned out good. A few stuck to the non stick foil when baking even with olive oil. I had enough to make 8 rolls. My family loved them!!! Definitely making again!

name: Robin Bower
review: The flavor was very good. They didn't brown up very much, though.

name: C Y.
review: It was good, tried it twice.

name: Ayl Santi
review: really good but i think i got the wrong paper. they ripped while in the oven

name: Lana
review: I put too much filling in each one which meant they fell apart. I used a bit of sauce in the mix to keep from drying out. Vietnamese sauce. Will cook again. Flavor was beautiful. I added red cabbage, snow peas and zucchini.

name: Tiffany Davy
review: yum. It took ages to roll the spring rolls, but it was a fun family activity!

name: Kirstie
review: Was tasty and they crisped nicely but was not indicated how fiddley they are to wrap. Wrapping on a wet chopping board helps prevent rice paper from sticking and tearing. I also only drizzled a small amount of oil. Good way to use up leftovers =]

name: Naomi K.
review: Loved it! Due to the lack of gluten products available to me where I'm currently residing I'm always looking for alternatives. I've made these a number of times especially when everyone else around me is eating samosas and all things fried. I've never had a problem with them browning. I just ensure I don't soak the rice papers for too long, I line my baking tray with baking paper and cook at the recommended temperature & turn them once the first side is brown. Thanks 😍

review: Great even with some substitutions. I used a blend of minced mushrooms, red pepper & green onion in lieu of pork and brown rice papers which seemed to work just fine!
